Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <Regnar> I think I've heard of someone saying this a little while back, I dont remember the reason it didn't have the shield tbh, it may have been a GUI bug. If it shows more than 1 confirmation, it has been notarized. You'll have more than 1 raw confirmations, but the main visible one only changes when it is notarized, basically an easy way for people to ensure it is as secure as possible. (re @TonyStarkBR: Btw, on v0.3.3, some of my transactions were not showing the shield even after several days, it started showing them after I updated to the latest version...)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <TonyStarkBR> Ok, thanks for your explanation! (re @Regnar: I think I've heard of someone saying this a little while back, I dont remember the reason it didn't have the shield tbh, it may have been a GUI bug. If it shows more than 1 confirmation, it has been notarized. You'll have more than 1 raw confirmations, but the main visible one only changes when it is notarized, basically an easy way for people to ensure it is as secure as possible.)

Content: [telegram] <PTYX11> Hi Jason, as you noticed the wallet is probably one of the easiest to use. The reason for that is the lack of advanced option and overwhelming buttons. Currently the wallet gives you a seed which you can use In Agama or any other wallet to recover your funds. In the near future we will have a privatekey export but for now the seed ensures you can always restore your funds. (re @Jason: Is it easy to access our private keys via the wallet?)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [telegram] <PTYX11> We are a Komodo service provider. We onboard projects and offer them whitelabel software which they can use to launch their own apps. We did launch the ZILLA coin to distribute rewards, raise funds, and also to implement cryptoconditions. However, we didn't raise enough ico funds so we refunded people. Now we are competing for VC funds and our MVP is ready. (re @TonyStarkBR: What's the relation of Chainzilla to Komodo?)
